level.description: You now have access to the <color=#ffff00ff>PRINTER</color> tool. The <color=#ffff00ff>PRINTER</color> will print output if you use it on <color=#ffff00ff>yellow</color> text. Use the BUGCATCHER to catch the bug once you know where it is. You can use TAB to switch between tools.
level.introtext: Time to learn a new tool: <color=#ffff00ff>PRINTERS</color>. They can show you output from the code.
level.endtext: That's right! You can now use <color=#ffff00ff>PRINTERS</color>!
level.tech: If you want to find the bug, try using the PRINTER tool to look at the variable values during execution. If a number doesn’t match what you think it should be, that’s an important clue!
level.hint1: Use the PRINTER to find the bug, then the Bug Fixer on the appropriate code.
level.hint2: Try using the Bug Fixer on the same code that was mentioned in the printed statement.
level.code: def FCalls(string errmsg): #call some functions then return print(errmsg) #try the PRINTER here!! function1() function2() function3() $bug$function4() function5() return;
